Sending my deepest condolences to all those affected by the senseless act that has occurred in Christchurch, New Zealand. There is no place for hatred and violence in any corner of our world.

On International Women's Day, I'm reflecting on the record number of women serving in Congress today. 

I'm honored to serve with these outstanding women & to continue the fight for equality and justice for all. We’ve got work to do. #IWD2019 https://nyti.ms/2RNKjPt
HBCUs are key to diversifying STEAM fields. The #BRIDGEAct ensures HBCUs and the students they serve have the tools to prepare for what tomorrow’s digital economy holds.

Today, I officially introduced my bill to support technology advancements at HBCUs: the #BRIDGEAct.

More on the #BRIDGEAct:  https://butterfield.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/butterfield-introduces-legislation-to-improve-technology-at-hbcus …
#HBCUSTRONG #HBCUSTEAM pic.twitter.com/z4QfCJRuv5

I visited the historic Edmund Pettus Bridge on the 50th anniversary of #BloodySunday to pay tribute to the courageous leaders who crossed the bridge in Selma that day in pursuit of the right to vote. Today and every day, we must protect the rights that so many sacrificed for. pic.twitter.com/na6MnjUOy2

Today is the 54th anniversary of Bloody Sunday, when nonviolent civil rights activists- including my friend @RepJohnLewis- marched from Selma to Montgomery before being attacked, bloodied, and arrested.

Their courage and sacrifice paved the way for the Voting Rights Act. pic.twitter.com/QHuGhame8m

I was proud to introduce my amendment to #HR1, the #ForthePeopleAct, on the House Floor yesterday. My amendment will ensure early voting locations in rural areas across the country are located where voters will have greatest access to cast their ballots. pic.twitter.com/HQXs3UeVXj

The stats don’t lie- there’s a real lack of diversity in the tech industry, and it is past time it is addressed.

As Co-Chair of #CBCTECH2020, I was glad to participate in today’s @EnergyCommerce hearing on how diversity benefits all Americans. pic.twitter.com/MafsAp4qoB

As a proud graduate & representative of an HBCU (@NCCU!), I am glad to be a member of the @HBCUCaucus! The Caucus is hosting #HBCU and industry leaders on Capitol Hill this week. We are committed to ensuring equal opportunity for #HBCUs and their students! #HBCUStrong #HBCUSTEAM pic.twitter.com/E5ugG0Lq4R
Tune in now: https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1103315550287982594 …

At 10:30: Joining @EnergyCommerce Subcommittee on Consumer Protection and Commerce hearing on diversity in tech. There is a persistent lack of diversity in tech that must be addressed. As co-chair of #CBCTECH2020, I look forward to participating. https://thehill.com/policy/technology/432765-dems-put-spotlight-on-diversity-in-tech#.XH_mkOKNjSE.twitter …
